content: and fourth needles knit to two stitches before the end of the fourth needle k2tog knit across the next two needles in the established pattern at the beginning of the third needle ssk continue these decreases every other row until you re back to 72 stitches continue foot in cable pattern until desired length minus the toe is reached knit across the first needles knit to the final three stitches of the fourth needle ssk k1 on the first needle k1 k2tog knit across knit to the final three stitches of the second needle ssk k1 on the third needle k1 k2tog knit across if you find this confusing it may help to think of it as doing aligned increases with the row split on the bottom of the foot instead of the side this makes the decrease edges a bit tidier continue these decreases every other row until you are down to 16 total stitches 4 on each needle transfer the 8 stitches from the top and bottom of the foot to 2 dpns kitchener to close the toe don t like kitchenering try this knitted graft tutorial from knitting daily http //www knittingdaily com/blogs/daily/archive/2008/12/22/finishing-­ tip-­ for-­ those-­ who-­ hate-­ the-­ kitchener-­ stitch aspx right sock knit as for the left sock but work the cable chart over the second needle instead of the first so the socks are mirror images of each other cable chart for left sock cable chart for right sock copyright librarypaste 2013
